title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0200

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And my name is Katherine, and we've got a special announcement to make today.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们有一个特别的公告。

segments.en: That's right, this is lesson number 200.
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
So, good job, EnglishPod.
We have over 200 lessons already in our library, so that's like enough for like six months of continuous learning, I think.
segments.cn: 我们的图书馆里已经有超过200节课了，这大约足够六个月的持续学习，我想。

segments.en: But the lessons keep coming and they keep getting better, so of course you should continue to listen to us.
segments.cn: 但是课程还在继续，而且越来越好，所以当然你应该继续听我们。

segments.en: We just thought we would mention that today is the special number 200.
segments.cn: 我们只是想提一下今天是特别的第200课。

segments.en: Exactly.
And because it's a special number, we're going to talk about a very laid back topic, but very interesting nonetheless.
segments.cn: 因为这是一个特别的数字，我们将讨论一个非常轻松但仍然很有趣的话题。

segments.en: We're talking about junk food.
You might argue that it's actually too laid back and is the cause of many problems in America and other places in the world.
segments.cn: 你可能会争辩说这实际上太轻松了，并且是美国和世界其他地方许多问题的根源。

segments.en: Junk food is unhealthy food.
segments.cn: 垃圾食品是不健康的食物。

segments.en: So let's take a listen to today's dialogue and we'll be back in a moment to talk about what's going on.
segments.cn: 所以让我们来听听今天的对话，我们马上回来讨论发生了什么。

segments.en: I'm hungry.
Let's go grab a bite to eat.
Sure.
How about we go home and prepare a couple of sandwiches?
segments.cn: 我们回家准备几个三明治怎么样？

segments.en: Nah, let's get a burger and fries.
segments.cn: 不，咱们去吃汉堡和薯条。

segments.en: All you ever do is have unhealthy fast food.
segments.cn: 你总是吃不健康的快餐。

segments.en: Pizza, fries, burgers, and hot dogs.
You have to start eating better.
What are you talking about?
I have salads sometimes.
Yeah, right.
I'm serious.
You should also cut down on your sugar intake as well.
segments.cn: 你还应该减少糖的摄入量。

segments.en: You drink carbonated drinks that are high in fructose syrup.
segments.cn: 你喝的碳酸饮料含有高果糖糖浆。

segments.en: It's really not healthy.
Fine.
I'll start drinking water and having home-cooked meals that are low in fat.
segments.cn: 我会开始喝水，吃低脂的家常菜。

segments.en: Are you happy now?
It's a start, but I'll be happy when I see you stick to your promise.
segments.cn: 这是个开始，但我会在看到你坚持你的承诺时才会开心。

segments.en: Alright, we're back so let's take a look at some of the great words and phrases all about junk food now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了，现在让我们看看一些关于垃圾食品的精彩单词和短语，在语言收获中。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
Mmm, my favorite.
This stuff makes me hungry.
But it's not very good for you.
It's not.
It's terrible.
And especially his favorite food was burger and fries.
segments.cn: 而且他最喜欢的食物是汉堡和薯条。

segments.en: Oh, had it for dinner last night.
Really?
Had burger and fries?
Yeah, maybe.
Well, it's not very healthy and there's a great way to describe this.
segments.cn: 嗯，这并不健康，有一个很好的方式来描述这个。

segments.en: The word is unhealthy.
Alright, so yes as you say it's very unhealthy.
segments.cn: 好吧，正如你所说，这非常不健康。

segments.en: Well, yeah, because you get fat they're very high in calories so it's unhealthy so that means it's not good for you.
segments.cn: 是的，因为你会变胖，它们的卡路里很高，所以不健康，这意味着对你不好。

segments.en: That's right.
So just a reminder, in English when we hear the word unhealthy or unhappy this means not healthy.
segments.cn: 所以提醒一下，在英语中，当我们听到“不健康”或“不快乐”这个词时，这意味着不健康。

segments.en: That's right.
Not happy.
UN is a prefix that means not.
Mm-hmm.
Okay, and talking about unhealthy food, in general what are we talking about?
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到不健康的食物，我们一般在谈论什么？

segments.en: We're talking about fast food.
Okay, so this might require a story.
segments.cn: 好吧，这可能需要一个故事。

segments.en: What is the meaning behind fast food as opposed to slow food?
segments.cn: 快餐与慢餐的意义是什么？

segments.en: Because there is no slow food, right?
I think now they have it in like France or something like that.
segments.cn: 我想现在他们在法国或其他地方有慢餐。

segments.en: They talk about slow food.
But anyways, fast food is food that is prepared very quickly.
segments.cn: 不过，快餐是准备得非常快的食物。

segments.en: So you go, you order, in two or three minutes you have your entire order ready to go.
segments.cn: 所以你去，点餐，2到3分钟内你就能拿到整个订单。

segments.en: Okay, so maybe this is the food that I could get at McDonald's or Burger King where they make it very very quickly and I can go home or I can go to the office with my food ready.
segments.cn: 好吧，也许这是我可以在麦当劳或汉堡王得到的食物，他们做得非常快，我可以带着食物回家或去办公室。

segments.en: Exactly.
So fast food, very popular among countries, very popular nowadays among busy people who have no time to sit down at a restaurant or eat or sit down and have a proper lunch.
segments.cn: 所以快餐在各国都很受欢迎，现在在忙碌的人群中也很受欢迎，他们没有时间坐在餐厅里吃饭或好好吃午餐。

segments.en: Fast food.
And one of the important drinks at a fast food restaurant is a carbonated drink.
segments.cn: 而在快餐店中一种重要的饮料是碳酸饮料。

segments.en: So this carbonated, what does this mean?
segments.cn: 那么这个碳酸的意思是什么？

segments.en: This is actually the fancy word for soda or for fizzy drink.
segments.cn: 这实际上是苏打水或气泡饮料的 fancy 词。

segments.en: Fizzy, okay, so something that's carbonated has bubbles.
segments.cn: 气泡，好的，所以碳酸的东西有气泡。

segments.en: Yeah, it has bubbles.
For example, a lot of Europeans drink carbonated water.
segments.cn: 例如，很多欧洲人喝碳酸水。

segments.en: That means water with bubbles in it.
Mm-hmm, that's right.
So actually the bubbles are caused because the drink has a high concentration of a certain gas such as So that's why it has all these bubbles and it's fizzy like Coca-cola, for example.
segments.cn: 所以实际上气泡是因为饮料中含有高浓度的某种气体，所以它才有这些气泡，像可乐这样的饮料就是这样。

segments.en: Right, Coca-cola or Sprite.
These are carbonated drinks.
Very good.
So you have carbonated water and you have carbonated soda.
segments.cn: 所以你有碳酸水和碳酸苏打。

segments.en: What is the thing that makes soda different?
segments.cn: 使苏打与众不同的是什么？

segments.en: What is it that makes soda taste so good?
segments.cn: 使苏打味道如此美妙的是什么？

segments.en: It's sweet and the ingredient that makes it sweet is called fructose syrup.
segments.cn: 它是甜的，而使其甜的成分叫做果糖糖浆。

segments.en: Fructose syrup is essentially sugar.
segments.cn: 果糖糖浆本质上就是糖。

segments.en: Yeah, and it comes from corn, I believe, right?
segments.cn: 是的，它来自玉米，我相信，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
So you can also hear the name corn syrup.
segments.cn: 所以你也可以听到玉米糖浆的名字。

segments.en: And this is a sweet syrup that comes from corn that makes drinks like Sprite and Coca-cola taste so good.
segments.cn: 这是一种来自玉米的甜糖浆，使得像雪碧和可乐这样的饮料味道如此美妙。

segments.en: It's also very unhealthy for you.
Yes, because it has a lot of calories.
segments.cn: 是的，因为它含有很多卡路里。

segments.en: So that is one of the main ingredients in soda.
segments.cn: 所以这是苏打的主要成分之一。

segments.en: Now you know you have fructose syrup.
segments.cn: 现在你知道你有果糖糖浆。

segments.en: All right, so that's all we've got for Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们在语言收获中所拥有的一切。

segments.en: Let's take another listen to today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍今天的对话。

segments.en: We'll be back in a I'm hungry.
Let's go grab a bite to eat.
Sure.
How about we go home and prepare a couple of sandwiches?
segments.cn: 我们回家准备几个三明治怎么样？

segments.en: Nah, let's get a burger and fries.
segments.cn: 不，咱们去吃汉堡和薯条吧。

segments.en: What you ever do is have unhealthy fast food.
segments.cn: 你总是吃不健康的快餐。

segments.en: Pizza, fries, burgers, and hot dogs.
You have to start eating better.
What are you talking about?
I have salads sometimes.
Yeah, right.
I'm serious.
You should also cut down on your sugar intake as well.
segments.cn: 你还应该减少糖的摄入。

segments.en: You drink carbonated drinks that are high in fructose syrup.
segments.cn: 你喝的碳酸饮料含有高果糖糖浆。

segments.en: It's that are low in fat.
Are you happy now?
It's a start, but I'll be happy when I see you stick to your promise.
segments.cn: 这是个开始，但我会在看到你遵守承诺时才开心。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
So now we have a couple of great phrases that we heard along the dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在我们有几个在对话中听到的好短语。

segments.en: So let's take a look at those now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们现在在流利度构建器中看看这些。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
All right, so starting off, this is a very interesting phrase because we saw it in the first sentence and it says, let's go grab a bite to eat.
segments.cn: 好吧，首先，这是一个非常有趣的短语，因为我们在第一句中看到了它，意思是，让我们去吃点东西。

segments.en: Let's grab a bite to eat.
So to grab is to hold something with your hand, okay, to do it quickly.
segments.cn: “抓”是用手握住某物，快速地做。

segments.en: He grabbed my arm.
So to grab a bite to eat, a bite is a small taste.
segments.cn: 所以“吃点东西”是指小口尝一尝。

segments.en: We're going to have a quick meal.
So after work, you want to go grab a bite to eat?
segments.cn: 所以下班后，你想去吃点东西吗？

segments.en: That means let's go have something to eat quickly.
segments.cn: 这意味着让我们快速吃点东西。

segments.en: Yeah, I'll be there soon.
Let me just grab a bite to eat.
So bite is a little bit.
It's a small amount of food.
Now for our next phrase, it's very important because I've noticed that a lot of our English learners make the mistake of using this phrase.
segments.cn: 现在对于下一个短语，这非常重要，因为我注意到很多英语学习者在使用这个短语时犯了错误。

segments.en: It's how about.
How about.
So in today's dialogue, the phrase is, how about we go home and prepare a couple of sandwiches?
segments.cn: 在今天的对话中，这个短语是，我们回家准备几个三明治怎么样？

segments.en: So how about is used as a suggestion is how do you feel or what do you think of going home and preparing a couple of sandwiches?
segments.cn: 所以“怎么样”用作建议，意思是你觉得怎么样，或者你认为回家准备几个三明治怎么样？

segments.en: So another way to say this is, why don't we go home and prepare some sandwiches?
segments.cn: 另一种说法是，为什么我们不回家准备一些三明治呢？

segments.en: Exactly.
But commonly, English learners make the mistake of using how about as a way of saying, how was it or how is it?
segments.cn: 但通常，英语学习者会错误地使用“怎么样”来表示“怎么样”或“如何”。

segments.en: So for example, how about your weekend?
Wrong.
Okay.
So how was your weekend?
Exactly.
So how about is usually used when we make a suggestion.
segments.cn: 所以“怎么样”通常用于我们提出建议时。

segments.en: How about we go see a movie on Saturday?
segments.cn: 我们周六去看电影怎么样？

segments.en: Or how about we go to my parents' house for Christmas this year?
segments.cn: 或者我们今年圣诞节去我父母家怎么样？

segments.en: Or finally, how about you get another job so that we can have more money to spend on going out to eat?
segments.cn: 或者最后，你找一份新工作，这样我们就可以有更多的钱去外面吃饭？

segments.en: Very good.
So how about these are all suggestions.
Why don't you get another job?
segments.cn: 为什么你不找一份新工作？

segments.en: Why don't we go to our parents' house for Christmas?
segments.cn: 为什么我们不去父母家过圣诞节？

segments.en: So you can't say, how about your weekend?
segments.cn: 所以你不能说，周末怎么样？

segments.en: You say, how was your weekend?
segments.cn: 你应该说，你的周末怎么样？

segments.en: So there's a big difference there.
segments.cn: 所以这里有很大的区别。

segments.en: Very good.
So make sure to stay away from that typical mistake using how about.
segments.cn: 所以一定要避免使用“怎么样”这个典型错误。

segments.en: Now moving on, we were talking about fast food and how it's bad for you.
segments.cn: 现在继续，我们在谈论快餐以及它对你有多糟糕。

segments.en: And she said, you know what?
You should also cut down on your sugar intake.
segments.cn: 你还应该减少糖的摄入。

segments.en: So to cut down, that's a phrasal verb.
segments.cn: 所以“减少”是一个短语动词。

segments.en: That's right.
Cut down.
So that means to decrease.
I'm trying to cut down on the amount of soda that I drink.
segments.cn: 我正在努力减少我喝的汽水量。

segments.en: Or I'm trying to cut down on how much I spend on the weekends.
segments.cn: 或者我正在努力减少我周末的花费。

segments.en: Okay, so to cut down means to decrease or to lessen.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以“减少”意味着减少或减轻。

segments.en: Very good.
And for our last phrase, the whole thing that we're talking about in one of the favorite meals for everyone, burger and fries.
segments.cn: 对于我们最后一个短语，整个谈论的内容是每个人最喜欢的餐点之一，汉堡和薯条。

segments.en: Okay, so this is one of many combinations for meals.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种多种餐点的组合之一。

segments.en: You can have a burger and fries, which is a hamburger and French fries.
segments.cn: 你可以吃汉堡和薯条，也就是汉堡和薯条。

segments.en: So oftentimes you say, hey, let's go grab a burger and fries.
segments.cn: 所以你常常会说，嘿，我们去吃汉堡和薯条吧。

segments.en: Yeah.
Another combination, especially in England, is fish and chips.
segments.cn: 另一种组合，尤其在英国，是鱼和薯条。

segments.en: Yeah, fish and chips.
Fish would be a fried fish sandwich and chips would be French fries as well.
segments.cn: 鱼是炸鱼三明治，薯条也是薯条。

segments.en: That's right.
So in actually in England, they call French fries, they call them chips.
segments.cn: 所以实际上在英国，他们称薯条为“薯条”。

segments.en: So if you're confused by the word chips or potato chips, and French fries, these are different things in different places.
segments.cn: 如果你对“薯条”或“土豆片”和“薯条”这个词感到困惑，这在不同地方是不同的。

segments.en: But if you're talking to an American, French fries is the way to go.
segments.cn: 但如果你和美国人谈论，薯条就是正确的说法。

segments.en: Or for a while they were called freedom fries.
segments.cn: 或者一段时间它们被称为自由薯条。

segments.en: Well, we don't need to talk about that.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们不需要谈论这个。

segments.en: We can talk about that in a later lesson.
segments.cn: 我们可以在以后的课程中谈论这个。

segments.en: But for now, the phrase is burger and fries.
segments.cn: 但现在，短语是汉堡和薯条。

segments.en: All right.
So let's listen to our dialogue for the very last time.
segments.cn: 所以让我们最后一次听我们的对话。

segments.en: I'm hungry.
Let's go grab a bite to eat.
Sure.
How about we go home and prepare a couple of sandwiches?
segments.cn: 我们回家准备几个三明治怎么样？

segments.en: Now let's get a burger and fries.
segments.cn: 现在我们去吃汉堡和薯条吧。

segments.en: What you ever do is have unhealthy fast food, pizza, fries, burgers and hot dogs.
segments.cn: 你总是吃不健康的快餐，比萨、薯条、汉堡和热狗。

segments.en: You have to start eating better.
What are you talking about?
I have salads sometimes.
Yeah, right.
I'm serious.
You should also cut down on your sugar intake as well.
segments.cn: 你还应该减少糖的摄入。

segments.en: You drink carbonated drinks that are high in fructose syrup.
segments.cn: 你喝的碳酸饮料含有高果糖糖浆。

segments.en: It's really not healthy.
Fine.
I'll start drinking water and having home cooked meals that are low in fat.
segments.cn: 我会开始喝水，吃低脂的家常菜。

segments.en: Are you happy now?
It's a start, but I'll be happy when I see you stick to your promise.
segments.cn: 这是个开始，但我会在看到你坚持承诺时才开心。

segments.en: We're back, Marco.
You're laughing.
I know you like junk food.
segments.cn: 我知道你喜欢垃圾食品。

segments.en: What's your favorite junk food of all time?
segments.cn: 你最喜欢的垃圾食品是什么？

segments.en: Actually, I am a big, big fan of fried chicken.
I love fried chicken.
Yummy.
It's, I don't know, it's I think it's really greasy and oily.
segments.cn: 我不知道，反正我觉得它真的很油腻。

segments.en: And it's very, very bad.
But I can't help it.
It's very good.
You can buy bags of it in America.
segments.cn: 在美国你可以买到袋装的。

segments.en: I get like a pound bag.
You buy it by the pound in America, right?
segments.cn: 在美国是按磅买的，对吧？

segments.en: Yep.
You pay, you pay for how much it weighs.
Wow.
That's amazing.
I actually really enjoy it.
But places like Kentucky Fried Chicken, they're too expensive for fried chicken.
segments.cn: 但像肯德基这样的地方，炸鸡太贵了。

segments.en: Yeah, you don't necessarily want to go there.
segments.cn: 是的，你不一定想去那里。

segments.en: There's other places that are a lot more maybe traditional that are pretty good.
segments.cn: 还有其他地方更传统，味道不错。

segments.en: How about you?
What is your favorite junk food?
segments.cn: 你最喜欢的垃圾食品是什么？

segments.en: Chicago style hot dog and French fries.
segments.cn: 芝加哥风味热狗和薯条。

segments.en: Like, you know, when you go to see a baseball game, you get a hot dog.
segments.cn: 就像你去看棒球比赛时，会买热狗。

segments.en: But Chicago style is good.
It's not too much stuff on it.
You have a poppy seed bun.
segments.cn: 你有一个罂粟种子面包。

segments.en: So it's a bun, a piece of bread with some seeds on it.
segments.cn: 所以是一个带种子的面包。

segments.en: And a lot of mustard and ketchup and onions.
segments.cn: 还有很多芥末、番茄酱和洋葱。

segments.en: I really enjoy hot dogs.
But the one thing that I cannot have on a hot dog is mustard or relish.
segments.cn: 但我不能在热狗上加芥末或调味酱。

segments.en: Oh my gosh, those are the two best things.
segments.cn: 哦，我的天，那是最好的两样东西。

segments.en: Okay, I can't talk to you anymore.
segments.cn: 好吧，我不能再和你说话了。

segments.en: Well, tell us what your favorite junk food is and tell Marco that he's crazy if he doesn't like mustard.
segments.cn: 好吧，告诉我们你最喜欢的垃圾食品是什么，并告诉马尔科，如果他不喜欢芥末，那他就是疯了。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
Ask us questions as well.
We're happy to answer them.
Until next time.
Bye everyone.
